subject: Communication
title: The Long Game of Ethical Influence
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Long Game of Ethical Influence usable.

hook.text: Manipulators win fast. Ethical influencers win slowly. But only one approach lasts.

buildup.text: Dark persuasion tactics create compliance but erode trust. Once exposed, the relationship collapses.

discovery.text: Ethical influence compounds: each honest interaction builds social capital that grows over years.

twist.text: Warren Buffett's reputation took 60 years to build. He says it takes five minutes to destroy.

climax.text: The leaders with the deepest influence are those who consistently chose integrity over short-term wins.

punchline.text: Manipulation is a sprint. Integrity is the marathon.

quiz.question: Why does ethical influence outperform manipulation long-term?
options: It builds compounding social capital and trust
